DOC.detailed_description: Chronic disease management ( CDM ) collaborative , longitudinal , proven effective approach treatment chronic medical illness address individual patient health system barrier receipt need treatment . The objective Addiction Health Evaluation And Disease management ( AHEAD ) Study test effectiveness CDM substance dependence primary care . The study enroll randomize subject attend substance dependence CDM program ( AHEAD Unit ) integrate real-world primary care clinic referral usual primary care . All subject assess regard alcohol and/or drug diagnosis , consumption problem , readiness change , health-related quality life , medical substance abuse treatment utilization . Primary outcome alcohol drug use , alcohol drug-related problem , emergency department visit , hospitalization . Additional outcome health-related quality life , readiness change , medical psychiatric comorbidity , HIV risk behavior , treatment utilization cost . The hypothesis compare standard care , health service intervention -- chronic disease management alcohol drug dependence integrate primary care -- decrease alcohol drug use relate problem , improve health care utilization pattern . This study contain two study ( study population ) : - 1 . 320 alcohol dependent subject current risky drinking , - 2 . 320 drug dependent subject current drug use .
